review: "Initial D, Volume 20" continues the thrilling and competitive world of street racing that I've come to love. The pacing is fast, and the tension in each race is palpable, especially with the introduction of a professional racer who challenges Project D. The character development, particularly for Tak and K.T., adds depth to the story, making it more than just about the cars. The artwork is also top-notch, capturing the speed and excitement of each scene. While the plot can be a bit predictable at times, the overall enjoyment and adrenaline rush make it a worthy addition to the series.
